page.title: 11Farming - Fruit Orchards
page.content: Wai-iti Orchards These were originally grassland, 25 acres purchased in l968 and l97l. l2 acres were subsequently planted with 6,500-7,000 apple trees. The remainder was occupied by house, garden, farm buildings and grass around and amid the orchards - giving 23 miles to be mowed regularly. The owner is the sole full-time worker helped part-time by his wife with picking, packing and orchard maintenance. The orchard was one of the first intensive ones in the area growing Cox Orange Pippin, Golden Delicious, Bramleys, Spartan and Crispin, planted in rows l2 ft. apart. Shelter belts comprise TxT 32 poplars with black & grey alders. Oaks, horse chesnuts and silver poplars have also been planted.
